newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila to bid out Yankee float on firm basis.
newsitem.headline: Manila to bid out Yankee float on firm basis.

text.p: The Philippine Central Bank had decided to bid out its inaugural Yankee bond issue to members of the underwriting team on a firm basis, governor Gabriel Singson said on Friday.
Singson denied reports in local newspapers that lead underwriter Salomon Brothers had been dropped. Salomon was also invited to bid for the bank's inaugural bond issue, he said.

"We have received firm underwriting offers, including from Salomon ... and other members. Being a government entity, when you received a firm offer like that, then you have to resort to an auction process, bidding process," Singson told Reuters.

"And this is what we've decided to do. We invited all of the six to a meeting yesterday to discuss the rules of the bidding. And all of them agreed to the bidding rule as evidenced by signing their conformity to the bidding rule."
